column4: what kinda of progams are there for remote desktop in ubuntu?
VNC, RDP (Remote Desktop), and X over SSH (this one is probably not what you want).
are you connecting *from* Linux, or *to* Linux?
then try VNC first. (there is a Remote Desktop server too)
vnc wouldnt happen to be in the package manager?
yeah, apt-cache search vnc -- I think GNOME uses 'vino' by default.
i see the rdv but i dont see the server..
i installed vnc and i dont know how to launch the vnc server
i just donno how to start it... didnt show up in aplications
